result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:09 AM Defendant Zohaib Mughal in court.  ADA Colleen Lennon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter David Roberts, appeared by phone. Interpreter duly sworn. Court colloquy with Defendant regarding attorney. Defn has applied for SPD but is not eligible. Defn chooses to complete the CDP paperwork. Shannon S from the Courthouse in the Courtroom to assist with completing the paperwork with the interpreter on the phone. Court makes determination that he is eligible for CDP.

Court removes the following bail conditions:
-Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Naddia A. 
-Defendant shall not be in the 5100 block of Great Gray Dr in Madison.

Court adds the following bail condition:
-No threats/acts of violence against: Naddia A.

All other conditions remain the same.
Defendant appeared in person without counsel. Told to go to SPD to apply. STC scheduled for on the record colloquy, NIH.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zohaib Mughal in court. Language Line interpreter #112238 interpreted. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
